column2: GM admits more problems with mislabeling of ignition switch parts DETROIT General Motors Co in 2003 and 2004 made changes to redesigned ignition switch parts on four models but did not ensure that older
column3: potentially faulty parts were taken out of circulation
column4: the automaker said in a filing with U.S. safety regulators made public on Friday. ~GM admits more problems with mislabeling of ignition switch parts DETROIT
column5: July 18 General Motors Co in 2003 and 2004 made changes to redesigned ignition switch parts on four models but did not ensure that older
column6: potentially faulty parts were taken out of circulation
column7: the automaker said in a filing with U.S. safety regulators made public on Friday. ~
